Class FileManager

Properties

relative : Int32
absolute : Int32
recursive : Int32
ignore_hidden : Int32

Methods

directory_separator().Char
path_separator().Char
to_String().String (inherited)
type_name().String (inherited)

Base Types
Object
Implicit Singletons
Global, ObjectManager, Math, BitwiseOperations, DegreesManager, RadiansManager, RandomNumberGenerator


Overview

FileManager is an automatically generated singleton representing the class context (aka static variables and methods) of class File.


See Also

  • File


Properties

relative : Int32

For use with directory_listing(Int32).


absolute : Int32

For use with directory_listing(Int32).


recursive : Int32

For use with directory_listing(Int32).


ignore_hidden : Int32

For use with directory_listing(Int32).


Methods

directory_separator().Char

Returns the directory seperator appropriate for the current OS.

  • Windows: \
  • Others: /


path_separator().Char

Returns the path separator (for separating two different paths) appropriate for the current OS.

  • Windows: ;
  • Others: :


to_String().String (inherited)

Returns a String representation of this object. Most classes should override this method to summarize an object's state for convenience in testing and debugging.


type_name().String (inherited)

Returns the true class name of this object. Implemented by the runtime; you should not override this method. Equivalent to calling "runtime_type.name" in the introspection library.

Example: 

 local Object obj = "Hello World"
 println( obj.type_name ) # prints: String

See also:

  • RuntimeType
